comments:
Create a plain file or a Java file in a project.  Make sure it is dirty.  
Delete the project from the workspace from another view, so that your editor 
loses focus.  E.g. delete from the Package Explorer.  Press the X button on the 
editor to close the editor.  A dialog will appear, press the close button.  The 
editor remains open and there are exceptions in the log.

When the modal dialog appears, the queued messages (including the one for 
close) are sent.  This occurs right in the middle of the activate caused when 
the X button is pressed, resulting in focus being given to the editor.  There 
should be a way to detect that the user is trying to close the editor before 
the event corresponding to IPartListener.partActivated() is fired.
Please attach the .log file as a plain/text file with the errors.

Thanx,
PW
Could I please see the exception.

PW
These logs are from 3.1.1 M20050929-0840.

Error when you reproduce the steps with a text file
